intro: Cordatifolium wuchengyii, commonly known as the Wucheng heartleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically a deep green and have a slightly waxy texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often blooming in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
